core_principle: Good assistants start with good documentation. Reliable assistants depend just as much on clear and well-structured help content as on models, prompts, and tuning.

high_impact_factors.name: One clear source of truth
high_impact_factors.description: Avoid spreading the same instruction across multiple pages with variations.

high_impact_factors.name: Clear document boundaries
high_impact_factors.description: Each page should focus on one primary intent or action. Pages that try to handle multiple intents are harder for AI agents to reason over.

high_impact_factors.name: Explicit outcomes
high_impact_factors.description: Clearly state what changes, what remains, and what cannot be undone. Do not rely on implied behavior.

high_impact_factors.name: Consistent naming across the product
high_impact_factors.description: Use the same terms everywhere for the same action or state.

high_impact_factors.name: Optimize for structure
high_impact_factors.description: Clear headings, lists, and sections work better than long explanatory paragraphs.

criteria.criterion: Prefer bullet points over long paragraphs
criteria.scoring_approach: Check paragraph length, presence of lists for procedural content

criteria.criterion: Break procedures into short, atomic steps with one action per step
criteria.scoring_approach: Analyze step complexity, count actions per instruction

criteria.criterion: Avoid embedding multiple actions within a single instruction
criteria.scoring_approach: Parse instructions for compound actions (and/then patterns)

criteria.criterion: Use clear, descriptive headings that reflect user intent
Keep workflows clearly separated
criteria.detail: Install, usage, and uninstall instructions should be on separate pages
criteria.scoring_approach: Check for workflow mixing on single pages

criteria.criterion: Avoid duplicated or conflicting instructions
Standardize action terms across all documentation
criteria.detail: Naming is part of information architecture

criteria.criterion: Avoid interchangeable terms that imply different outcomes

examples.good_practice: Each term has distinct, documented meaning

criteria.scoring_approach: Check for term conflation in similar contexts

criteria.criterion: Describe what changes as a result of the action
criteria.scoring_approach: Check for outcome statements after action descriptions

criteria.criterion: Explicitly state what data or settings are affected
Clearly indicate whether the action is reversible
Include disclaimer or note for major destructive actions
criteria.example: WorkDrive Sync uninstall note: 'When you uninstall the Sync app from your computer, the files already synced to your computer will not be deleted automatically.'

criteria.criterion: Clearly define the scope and eligibility for each action
Explicitly mention supported plans and product editions
examples: In Free plan, only 2000 requests are allowed per day per user
In Standard plan, API support is not available for this feature

criteria.criterion: Clearly state required roles and permissions
criteria.example: Only Workspace admins can perform this action

criteria.criterion: Call out preconditions that must be met before the action is available
criteria.example: Feature is available only for IN / EU region users

criteria.criterion: Clearly mention pricing details, features, and usage limits for all available plans
Maintain region-wise standardization across all pricing pages
Clearly label free vs paid capabilities and trial limitations
Use text-based labels in plan comparison tables instead of icons
criteria.detail: Use 'Available', 'Supported', 'Not supported' instead of checkmarks or crosses. At minimum, include this information in tooltips or ARIA labels.
criteria.scoring_approach: Check for icon-only cells without text alternatives

criteria.criterion: Focus FAQs on user goals and outcomes, not feature names

intent_driven_good: I want to stop syncing data
I need to sync contacts between two apps

criteria.scoring_approach: Analyze FAQ phrasing for user-goal orientation vs feature orientation

criteria.criterion: Periodically review community posts and migrate valid information into official help documentation
criteria.detail: Community pages contain user-generated content that can be outdated or inconsistent. Maintain a single, reliable source for the Assistant.
criteria.scoring_approach: Check for information gaps between community content and official docs

criteria.criterion: Describe steps and workflows in clear text instead of relying on images, screenshots, or PPTs
criteria.scoring_approach: Flag image-heavy pages without text alternatives

criteria.criterion: Use visuals as supporting material, not as the primary source of instructions
criteria.scoring_approach: Check text-to-image ratio for procedural content

criteria.criterion: Ensure all critical steps, conditions, and outcomes are explicitly written out in words
criteria.scoring_approach: Check for text coverage of key information

maintenance_recommendations.description: Help content and Assistants need to evolve together
actions: Analyze Assistant conversations and responses to understand behavior
Use repeated questions and Assistant failures to identify gaps
Add or update documents based on identified gaps

community_suggestions.suggestion: Include Zoho Learn for internal documentation retrieval
Implement LLMs.txt with chatbot across Zoho pages for AI readiness
